author: jovanka_
content: Hi guys, I am trying to understand rewards. I was convinced that block proposer receives also some reward for proposing the block, but when I went through Ben Edgington's eth2book.info (https://eth2book.info/bellatrix/part2/incentives/rewards/) it seems that block proposer only gets rewards from including attestations. Am I right?

author: jameshe5018
content: no you get rewards for attestations, but also if you're lucky enough to propose a block you get fees as reward ( not some set amount like with pow)

author: jovanka_
content: Hmm but the equations on the link above prove that you can quite precisely determine the reward

author: jovanka_
content: Or when you say "fees" are you referring to so called "tip" for transaction inclusion?

author: pietjepuk
content: I mean, a different question to ask is, why would we want to pay a block proposer for doing nothing useful (i.e. not including attestations, slashings, etc)?

author: jovanka_
content: Most of the sources online are nonchalantly calling it "reward for proposing a block" or similar. Thus, I thought proposing also brings some reward by itself. I though it is just one of the rewards that also helps to keep nodes encouraged to validate and hopefully propose every now and then

author: arnili
content: including attestations and sync committee signatures is a very reliable and predictable amount and it's in everyone's interest to include them, you can think of it as the "base reward" if you like

author: arnili
content: while the network is in clear consensus you will have one well aggregated (95%+) attestation per subnet for you to include at each slot plus a little extra if you have space for them

author: jovanka_
content: Thanks for response! Yes, I agree, but the point of my question was to check if there is any reward for just pure act of proposing a block (without including attestations) and it seems that there is actually not

author: arnili
content: care to elaborate why one would chose not to include attestations (and still expect a reward in return)? purely hypothetical?

author: arnili
content: this would be like a delivery service that gets paid per item, comes to your door but brings no items, wonders why it doesn't get paid ü§∑‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è

author: jovanka_
content: I meant in addition to rewards received for including attestation, I thought that there might be also reward for act of proposing as well. Like sum_reward = reward_for_proposing + attestations_inclusion_reward

author: arnili
content: current total rewards for just doing what the network expects of the proposer is quite reliably ~0.031ETH though, that's clearly enough of an incentive

author: jovanka_
content: Hmm can you please point me how you reached (or from where) this number of 0.031 ETH?

author: arnili
content: just take any validator that recently proposed, beaconchain explains the balance change if you hover the value: https://beaconcha.in/validator/452934

author: jovanka_
content: Ahhh you mean the consensus income :D?

author: jovanka_
content: Yeah, that is probably just sum of attestation inclusion rewards

author: arnili
content: "consensus income" is mainly rewards from making and including attestations

author: jovanka_
content: Yep

author: arnili
content: so you meant some sort of EL base reward? there is none, if i'm not mistaken EL does not create any more coins since the merge

author: arnili
content: etherscan also shows this as plain zero

author: jovanka_
content: Yes, I guess you can look at it like that. You are right, there are no more block rewards. If I am not mistaken now you can only get "tip"
